title: Paris crowns Sri Lankan baker for best traditional baguette
byline: Sri Lankan-born baker Sithamparappillai Jegatheepan has won the coveted Grand Prix de la baguette de Paris 2026, the best traditional baguette prize, on his first attempt.

title: Showers and thunder showers expected as Sri Lanka begin withdrawing from Northeast Monsoon
byline: Showers or thunder showers were forecasted in some parts of Sri Lanka as the country is withdrawing from the Northeast monsoon, the Department of Meteorology said yesterday.

title: Trade Unions withdraw from Ditwah relief services
byline: Amidst more than 3,000 individuals still being sheltered in safe centres, trade unions including Grama Niladharis, Disaster Relief Service Officers and Technical Officers attached to the Cyclone Ditwah-related relief services yesterday announced their withdrawal from all relief services citing the government’s failure in adopting a proper mechanism for relief services.

title: CID detains Suresh Sallay for 90 days
byline: Former Director of the State Intelligence Service, retired Major General Suresh Sallay, has been granted permission to be detained for 90 days for questioning in connection with ongoing investigations into the 2019 Easter Sunday terror attacks.

title: Sri Lankan exporters to see tariff relief amid volatile US trade environment
byline: ​The Sri Lankan exporters could soon experience a measure of relief following a recent US Supreme Court ruling that struck down the reciprocal tariffs imposed under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act.

title: Actor-Politician Vijay’s wife files for divorce
byline: Actor-politician Vijay’s wife Sangeetha Sornalingam has filed for divorce in a court in Chengalpattu, Tamil Nadu. Sangeetha wants the marriage dissolved.

title: Chelsea to face holders PSG in Champions League’s last 16
byline: Chelsea will play holders Paris St-Germain in the Champions League round of 16 while Manchester City will face Real Madrid in the knockout stages for a fifth straight season.

title: Pakistan strikes Afghan cities as cross-border attacks escalate
byline: Pakistan launched strikes on the Afghan cities of Kabul and Kandahar in the early hours of Friday, according to Pakistani government officials.

title: United States aids Israel in attack on Iran as tensions high over nuclear talks
byline: Israel launched a daylight attack Saturday on Iran’s capital, with a cloud of smoke rising from the city’s downtown. The first apparent strike happened near the offices of Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei.

title: India launches floating dry dock for Sri Lanka Navy
byline: A 4,000-tonne Floating Dry Dock (FDD) constructed for the Sri Lanka Navy (SLN) was officially launched last week at Goa Shipyard Limited (GSL), after several years of negotiations, planning and high-level defence discussions between India and Sri Lanka.

title: At least 15 killed after military plane carrying banknotes crashes in Bolivia
byline: At least 15 people have been killed and others injured after a Bolivian air force cargo plane crashed in the western city of El Alto, the country’s authorities say.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo buys 25 percent stake in Spanish second-tier club Almeria
byline: Cristiano Ronaldo has bought a stake in Spanish second-division football club Almeria, according to a consulting firm representing the Portuguese athlete.

title: Monk faces fraud allegations over fake “Ditwah” relief scheme
byline: A monk from Pilimatalawa, alleged to have fraudulently obtained money by falsely posing as the Deputy Minister of Industries and Entrepreneurship and claiming that relief would be provided to entrepreneurs affected by the “Ditwah” cyclone, was arrested by the Central Crime Investigation Bureau and produced before court.

title: Vehicle imports decline in January: Central Bank
byline: The imports of vehicles, including both personal and commercial vehicles, declined in January 2026 to USD 224 million when compared to December 2025, which recorded USD 301 million, the Central Bank said.

title: Sri Lanka makes presentation on ’’Sri Lanka EXPO 2026’’ in Germany
byline: Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath said he had fruitful discussions on economic and investment landscape of Sri Lanka, trade relations, tourism and skilled employment opportunities during his visit to Germany.

title: Energy crisis if coal tender cancelled, Govt weighs options
byline: The country is slated to face an energy crisis if the current coal tender is cancelled over the low quality supplies, an official said.

title: Airlines suspend Middle East flights after US, Israel strikes on Iran
byline: Global airlines suspended flights across the Middle East on Saturday after the United States and Israel launched strikes on Iran, plunging the region into a renewed military confrontation.

title: US, Israel attack Iran: Trump announces ‘major combat operations’
byline: United States President Donald Trump says the US has begun “major combat operations” in Iran after Israel also said it ⁠had launched missile attacks against the country.

title: After Sallay, Gotabaya Rajapaksa is the next - Ex MP
byline: Former Minister and National Freedom Front (NFF) leader Wimal Weerawansa yesterday alleged that the arrest of Major General (rtd) Suresh Salley is a politically motivated move aimed at appeasing elements of the Tamil diaspora while undermining national security.

title: Burj Khalifa Evacuated As Israel-Iran Conflict Reaches Dubai’s Doorstep
byline: Dubai’s Burj Khalifa, the world’s tallest building, was evacuated after explosions were heard across the city as Iran launched retaliatory missile strikes targeting US military locations across the Gulf following joint American and Israeli attacks on Tehran.

title: Fuel stocks are sufficient for more than a month, no reason to panic: CPC
byline: Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) chairman D.J. Rajakaruna said fuel stocks in the country and shipments in transit are sufficient for more than a month.

title: Foreign Ministry monitoring situation in Middle East; Emergency hotlines activated
byline: The Foreign Affairs Ministry said  that it is maintaining close contact with all Sri Lankan diplomatic missions across the Middle Eastern region and continues to closely monitor ongoing developments.

title: Ensure safety of Sri Lankans in Middle East: Sajith
byline: While expressing his concern on the developments in the Middle East, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa today urged the government to ensure the safety of Sri Lankans living in the region.

title: This is not your war’: Omani foreign minister urges US ‘not to get sucked in further’
byline: We have the first public reaction by Badr Albusaidi, the foreign minister of Oman, who had been mediating the recent rounds of indirect talks between the US and Iran.

title: Israeli security source says will continue Iran strikes ’as long as we need’
byline: An Israeli security source said that strikes on Iran would continue for ’’as long as we need’’, after the US and Israel began targeting military and ballistic missile sites in the Islamic republic on Saturday.

title: Foreign Ministry activates emergency response for Sri Lankans in Middle East
byline: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs Sri Lanka said that it is maintaining close and continuous contact with all Sri Lankan diplomatic missions across the Middle Eastern region amid the escalating tensions.

title: Mattala on standby to accommodate diverted flights if necessary: CAASL
byline: The Civil Aviation Authority (CAASL) said that the Mattala Rajapaksa International Airport (MRIA) has been placed on standby to accommodate diverted flights if necessary amidts escalating tensions in the Middle East region.

title: Sri Lanka suspends all flights to Middle East
byline: The Civil Aviation Authority of Sri Lanka (CAASL) has officially announced the immediate temporary suspension of all flights from Sri Lanka to destinations in the Middle East, citing the rapidly deteriorating military situation in the region.

title: SriLankan Airlines cancels ten flights to Middle East
byline: SriLankan Airlines has cancelled ten flights scheduled to operate today due to the closure of airspace in certain parts of the Middle East amid escalating tensions in the region, SriLankan Airlines said.

title: SLAF dismisses rumours of foreign military jets in Sri Lankan airspace
byline: The Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) has  dismissed social media rumours claiming that foreign military jets have been granted clearance to operate within Sri Lankan airspace.

title: Explosions in Israel, Bahrain, UAE, Kuwait
byline: Explosions rocked northern Israel as the country worked to intercept incoming Iranian missiles shortly after it attacked Iran. The blasts echoed just after the Israeli military said it would be using its air defence systems to bring down the Iranian fire. There was no immediate word on any casualties or damage from the ongoing attack.

title: Sri Lanka grants free 7-day visa extension for stranded foreing passengers
byline: The Department of Immigration and Emigration has announced a special concession for foreign nationals stranded in Sri Lanka following the cancellation of Middle East–bound flights effective from February 28, 2026.

title: Iran defence minister, Guards commander killed in Israeli attacks; Reuters
byline: Iran’s Defence Minister Amir Nasirzadeh and Revolutionary Guards commander Mohammed Pakpour are believed to have been killed in Israeli attacks, two sources familiar with Israel’s military operations and one regional source said.

title: Full list of Middle East cities where explosions were heard amid US-Iran conflict
byline: Tensions have soared in the Middle East as the US-Israel alliance conducted a joint strike against Iran in a bid to topple its regime. However, what began as an Israeli ’pre-emptive military strike’ against Iran, escalated into proxy attacks on US bases in the Middle East by Iran and on pro-Iranian militant groups in the region by the US and Israel.

title: Iranian missiles shake Gulf cities after US, Israeli strikes on Iran
byline: Iran fired missiles at several Arab Gulf cities on Saturday, causing waves of blasts, shaking windows and sending people rushing for cover in rare and potentially far-reaching attacks on a region that prides itself on its security.

title: CPC revises fuel prices effective from tonight
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) announced revisions to fuel prices, effective from midnight today (28), based on the monthly price formula.

title: Ministry issues advisory for Sri Lankans in Middle East
byline: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism has issued a special announcement regarding Sri Lankans residing in countries affected by the ongoing tensions in the Middle East.

title: Iran defence minister, Guards commander killed in Israeli attacks, three sources say
byline: Iran’s Defence Minister Amir Nasirzadeh and Revolutionary Guards commander Mohammed Pakpour are believed to have been killed in Israeli attacks, two sources familiar with Israel’s military operations and one regional source said.

title: Sri Lanka Embassy in Abu Dhabi issues advisory to Sri Lankan nationals
byline: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Abu Dhabi has issued a notice advising Sri Lankan nationals in the United Arab Emirates to exercise caution in light of the current situation in the Middle East.

title: Sri Lanka calls for utmost restraint and immediate de-escalation in the Middle East
byline: The Sri Lanka Government has expressed deep concern over the rapid escalation of hostilities in the Middle East, warning that the situation poses a serious threat to regional stability and international peace and security.

title: Namal urges preparedness amid rising global tensions
byline: Former Minister and MP Namal Rajapaksa has called on the government to remain vigilant and prepared in the face of escalating global tensions involving the United States, Israel, and Iran.

title: Burj Khalifa evacuated as Israel-Iran conflict reaches Dubai’s doorstep
byline: Dubai’s Burj Khalifa, the world’s tallest building, was evacuated after explosions were heard across the city as Iran launched retaliatory missile strikes targeting US military locations across the Gulf following joint American and Israeli attacks on Tehran.

title: Israeli security source says will continue Iran strikes ’as long as we need’
byline: An Israeli security source said that strikes on Iran would continue for ’’as long as we need’’, after the US and Israel began targeting military and ballistic missile sites in the Islamic republic on Saturday.

title: Explosions in Israel, Bahrain, UAE, Kuwait
byline: Explosions rocked northern Israel as the country worked to intercept incoming Iranian missiles shortly after it attacked Iran. The blasts echoed just after the Israeli military said it would be using its air defence systems to bring down the Iranian fire. There was no immediate word on any casualties or damage from the ongoing attack.
